title: 1,800 km in 13 minutes: How Russia's Oreshnik missiles rained fire on Ukraine; videos show impact
content: Ukraine reported Russia's rare use of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile during a large overnight attack, with fragments recovered near Lviv. This nuclear-capable weapon, claimed by Moscow to be uninterceptable, targeted infrastructure close to the EU border as part of a wider assault.

title: Another Maduro-style op? 'Be prepared': Iran's exiled prince issues 'urgent' call for Trump
content: Exiled Iranian Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has urged President Trump to intervene as widespread protests, initially economic, now challenge the Islamic Republic. Demonstrators chant anti-regime slogans, with at least 62 killed and over 2,300 detained amid an internet blackout. Iran's leadership has responded with threats of severe punishment.

title: Mustafizur row: 'Not our domain' - BCCI's fresh stance on Bangladesh venue issue
content: Bangladesh have asked the ICC to move their T20 World Cup matches out of India after the BCCI instructed IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) to release Mustafizur Rahman, "due to the recent developments".

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page are 'cutting ties' with Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Sensex, Nifty down over 2% in 5 sessions: All eyes on US SC ruling on Trump tariffs - what it means
content: Indian markets are on edge ahead of a crucial US Supreme Court ruling on Trump-era tariffs, which could either spark a sharp rally or intensify volatility depending on the scope of the decision.

title: Musk impressed with China, says 'Does things I say'; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk noted China's rapid adoption of electric vehicles, batteries, and solar power, mirroring his suggestions. He emphasized batteries as key to boosting US energy output without new power plants. Tesla's Megapacks and Megablock offer utility-scale storage solutions. Musk also warned of potential silver price hikes due to Chinese export restrictions.

title: Iran protests: Why are women lighting cigarettes from burning Khamenei photo? See photos
content: Iranian women are seen burning images of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei amidst escalating protests fueled by severe economic hardship. The nation's currency has plummeted, inflation has soared, and food prices have surged, leading to widespread discontent and demonstrations not seen since the 2022-23 unrest.

title: WPL: Honey Singh's entry catches Mandhana, Kaur off-guard - Watch
content: WPL 2026 began with a glitzy opening ceremony at DY Patil Stadium, highlighted by Honey Singh’s surprise entry that caught captains Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur off-guard and went viral. On the field, RCB won the toss and chose to bowl against MI. The season-opening clash marked a lively start to the January–February edition of the league.

title: 1 USD = 1,400,000 IRR: Iran on edge - why this is the most dangerous uprising yet
content: Iran's latest protests, sparked by a devastating economic collapse and a plummeting currency, are unlike previous unrest. This wave sees a broader social coalition, including merchants, demanding regime change. Unlike past uprisings, the trigger is not a single outrage but the daily futility of a broken economy, making this a critical legitimacy crisis for Tehran.

title: 'Owning the sea': The moment US forces intercepted sanctioned oil tanker in Caribbean Sea - watch
content: The United States has seized a sanctioned oil tanker, the Olina, in international waters as part of an ongoing campaign against "ghost fleet" vessels. This action, aimed at enforcing sanctions on Venezuela's oil, has drawn strong condemnation from Moscow, which accuses the US of violating international law and risking escalation.

title: Pakistan wants Netanyahu kidnapped? Khawaja Asif’s controversial appeal to US, Turkey – watch
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif controversially urged the US and Turkey to 'kidnap' Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, calling him the 'worst criminal of humanity' for actions in Gaza. Asif claimed historical atrocities against Palestinians are unmatched, and Pakistanis pray for Netanyahu's apprehension, referencing ICC warrants.

title: Pietersen wants IPL and PSL-winning coach to replace McCullum
content: After England’s 4-1 Ashes loss to Australia, Kevin Pietersen called for changes in the coaching setup and backed former coach Andy Flower as a possible replacement for Brendon McCullum. Calling it a “wild thought,” Pietersen said Flower has evolved and understands modern players. Flower previously led England to major successes and has since won titles in the PSL, The Hundred and IPL.

title: Candace Owens sparks new Charlie Kirk questions after unseen image surfaces
content: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Stefon Diggs–Cardi B drama becomes Patriots playoff distraction
content: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: Corey Perry exits Kings after being placed on non-roster status
content: Los Angeles Kings veteran Corey Perry has stepped away from the team after being placed on non-roster status due to a family-related illness. The decision prompted emergency roster moves from the Ontario Reign as the Kings adjusted during the 2025–26 NHL season, with Perry’s leadership and production temporarily absent from the lineup.

title: Himachal Pradesh: 9 dead, 40 injured as private bus falls into 500-feet deep gorge in Sirmaur - video
content: A devastating bus accident in Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district claimed at least nine lives and injured 40 others when a private bus plunged into a 500-feet gorge. The vehicle, en route from Shimla to Kupvi, veered off a narrow road near Haripurdhar. Himachal Pradesh chief minister extended his condolences and promised full support to affected families.

title: 'Modi–Trump share friendly ties': MEA on US President's 'sir' remark, says there is mutual respect
content: The ministry of external affairs rejected recent claims by Donald Trump, declaring that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the US President "share a friendly relationship based on mutual respect." The MEA's comments came in response to recent remarks made by Trump earlier this week at the House GOP Member Retreat.

title: 'Did nothing wrong': Mamata on action during ED raids; makes coal scam charge against BJP
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee defended her interference during ED's I-PAC raids, alleging the agency sought to "steal" her party's data. She accused senior BJP leaders in Delhi of receiving "coal scam proceeds" and claimed the BJP won Maharashtra by "stealing the mandate" with EC's help, aiming to do the same in Bengal.

title: Greenland, Iran, Colombia? Who's next on Trump's bombing radar
content: President Trump's 'Donroe Doctrine' has reshaped global politics, marked by aggressive military actions in Venezuela, Iran, and beyond. While seeking peace, he simultaneously orchestrates interventions, eyeing territories like Greenland and Mexico. This dual approach, blending diplomacy with forceful assertion, places numerous nations under a shadow of potential US military engagement.

title: How a simple school prayer turned 23-year-old teacher from Bihar into an internet star
content: A Gaya teacher's simple morning prayer rendition of a Bhagavad Gita shloka unexpectedly went viral, touching millions. Shalini Singh, who uses music to impart wisdom to her students, found her lifelong passion recognized. Her journey, supported by family and school, highlights faith, perseverance, and the meaningful impact of sincere dedication.

title: ‘Closely monitoring’: MEA expresses concerns over Minneapolis shooting
content: India's External Affairs Ministry is closely watching a shooting incident in Minneapolis involving a US immigration agent, given the large Indian population there. The US Department of Homeland Security stated an ICE officer fired defensively after a vehicle attempted to run over officers during an immigration operation. The alleged perpetrator died, and injured officers are recovering.

title: 'You have 2 wives while I have none': K'taka man kills dad for not arranging his marriage
content: A 35-year-old farmer in Chitradurga district allegedly beat his father to death after an argument over his own unarranged marriage. The accused, S Ningaraja, was reportedly angry that his father, who had married twice, had not arranged his own wedding. The victim was attacked with an iron rod while sleeping.

title: Jay Shah calls Rohit 'our captain'; batter's reaction goes viral - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma smiled with pride after ICC chairman Jay Shah referred to him as India’s captain at a public event, despite him no longer holding the ODI role. The moment went viral online. Rohit led India to the T20 World Cup 2024 and Champions Trophy 2025. Now retired from Tests and T20Is, he is set to play in India’s upcoming ODI series starting January 11.

title: Thailand–Cambodia border truce: US announces $45mn aid package to stabilise ceasefire
content: The United States announced a $45 million aid package for Thailand and Cambodia to bolster a fragile border ceasefire and promote regional stability. The funds will support border communities, demining efforts, and programs to combat drug trafficking and online scams, reinforcing US commitment to a secure Indo-Pacific.

title: Larry Bird and Dinah Mattingly’s combined net worth and NBA legacy
content: NBA legend Larry Bird, a three-time champion with the Boston Celtics, boasts a remarkable career marked by numerous accolades. Beyond his on-court success, Bird has maintained a private personal life, with two marriages and adopted children. His estimated net worth, combined with his wife, Dinah Mattingly, reflects his enduring career earnings and brand endorsements.

title: Why RBI isn't targeting Rupee's price band — the 'impossible trilemma' explained
content: The Indian rupee crossed Rs 90 to the dollar in early December 2025, marking its weakest level on record. Why did the RBI allow the currency to slide instead of stepping in to defend it, and why are policymakers insisting they are not worried? The answers lie in a hard economic constraint that leaves central banks with fewer choices than they appear to have.

title: ‘Focus on responsibilities’: MEA hits back at Mamdani’s letter to Umar Khalid as ‘prejudice’
content: Ministry of external affairs has sharply criticized New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani' letter to jailed activist Umar Khalid. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that personal prejudices are unbecoming of public officials and urged respect for judicial independence.

title: Gujarat shocker: 67-year-old man put under ‘digital arrest’ for 6 days; duped of Rs 35L
content: A 67-year-old retired man was subjected to a six-day "digital arrest" by cyberfraudsters posing as TRAI, Maharashtra cybercrime, and senior police officials. The elaborate scam led to the victim being duped of Rs 35.25 lakh through a series of threats and demands for financial information.

title: Israel–Hezbollah tensions: Tel Aviv launches fresh strikes across Lebanon
content: Israel launched air strikes on Hezbollah sites in Lebanon, targeting weapons facilities and production sites. This follows Lebanon's announcement of disarming the group in the south. While Israel deems the Lebanese army's efforts an encouraging start, it insists full disarmament is necessary, citing ongoing Hezbollah rearmament as a threat.

title: Thirty years ago, a punt helped the country to World Cup triumph
content: To win a Cricket World Cup, all your elements — batting, bowling and fielding — need to collectively work well. Consistency in team efforts, along with a few individuals’ standout performances, makes a team the World Champion. But sometimes a decision, technical or tactical, during the buildup to such a mega event turns out to be a trump card for the team, leading them to massive success.

title: 'Inaccurate': MEA rebuts Trump aide's 'PM did not call' remarks; cites 8 Modi-Trump calls in 2025
content: Ministry of external affairs has refuted US secretary of commerce Howard Lutnick's claims regarding trade deal negotiations. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that Lutnick's remarks were inaccurate, highlighting multiple rounds of talks and the closeness of a deal on several occasions. He also confirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump have spoken eight times in 2025.

title: 'Hands of US president stained with blood': Khamenei says 'arrogant' Trump will be overthrown
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a stern warning to protesters, vowing the Islamic Republic would back down to the unrest and further accused foreign-backed elements of seeking to destabilize the nation.  Amidst a communications blackout, demonstrations over soaring inflation have escalated, with rights groups reporting dozens killed and thousands detained.

title: ‘Removed from reality’: SC pushes back on Sharmila Tagore's plea in stray dogs case
content: The Supreme Court continues hearing pleas on stray dog management. Actor Sharmila Tagore's counsel argued for science-based solutions. Lawyers debated the Animal Birth Control rules and identifying aggressive dogs. The court cautioned against romanticizing dogs in hospitals. Suggestions for identification were raised. Welfare groups stressed proper rule enforcement. The court considered constitutional limits and empathy in its interim order.

title: 'Cousin thought I died': Jemimah Rodrigues recalls horrific 'church' incident
content: Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues recalled a scary childhood incident where she fell from the first floor during a church programme while playing with cousins, making them think she had died. Luckily unharmed, the story is now a fond memory. Today, Jemimah is a World Cup hero and the newly appointed Delhi Capitals captain.

title: Air pollution crisis: 44% Indian cities face chronic PM2.5 levels; NCAP covers just 4%
content: A new analysis reveals nearly half of Indian cities grapple with chronic air pollution, a persistent issue stemming from ongoing emission sources.  The National Clean Air Programme currently covers only a fraction of these severely affected urban areas, highlighting a significant gap in addressing the crisis.  Experts urge targeted reforms and a broader approach to combat this widespread problem.

title: Fans melt over Karl-Anthony Towns and Jordyn Woods’ custom engagement cards
content: New York Knicks star Karl-Anthony Towns proposed to Jordyn Woods on Christmas. The couple announced their engagement on Instagram. Custom trading cards celebrating their proposal were revealed, drawing warm fan reactions. Towns also shared details about the engagement ring's meaning. Their relationship has overcome significant challenges, including the loss of Towns' mother.

title: Mamata hits the streets: Bengal CM leads Kolkata rally against ED raids on I-PAC; watch
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a protest in Kolkata against the Enforcement Directorate's raids on I-PAC, accusing the central agency of attempting to access TMC's internal data. The party claims the ED's actions are politically motivated to intimidate opposition. Similar protests occurred in Delhi, with TMC MPs detained.

title: ‘Hug hug na raha’: Congress takes dig at PM Modi over stalled India–US trade deal
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised the BJP-led Centre, citing US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick's comments that India missed a trade deal with the US due to a lack of direct leadership engagement. Lutnick claimed Prime Minister Modi did not personally call then-President Trump, stalling advanced negotiations. The US subsequently finalized deals with other regional countries.

title: Why has Sensex plunged over 2,100 points, Nifty down over 2%? Top 5 reasons explained
content: Stock market crash: Indian equities extended their slide to a fifth straight session on Friday as global trade worries and political uncertainty drove a broad selloff, several lakh crore in market cap.

title: Humour, friendship, politics: leaders reflect on laughter and respect
content: Political leaders C.P. John, P.K. Basheer, K. Muraleedharan, and Pannian Ravindran speak at a panel discussion on ‘Humour in politics’ at the Kerala Legislature International Book Festival

title: DPDP Act does not ‘dilute’ RTI Act, A-G says in opinion
content: Civil society groups have argued that the Act’s amendment of Section 8(1)(j), turning a partial exemption for government bodies to turn over “personal” information into a total exemption, undermined transparency

title: Evict SASTRA University from 31.37 acres of government land, says Madras High Court
content: The Third Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan says that the Thanjavur Collector can seek the assitance of the police, if required, for the eviction within four weeks

title: Confident of LDF’s resounding victory in 2026 Kerala Assembly elections: T.P. Ramakrishnan
content: State govt. analyses results of local body elections and discusses strategies to counter the Union government’s continuing “economic blockade” of the State

title: Calcutta High Court adjourns hearing on ED plea over alleged obstruction during IPAC raid
content: The ED alleged that their raid at IPAC’s office was hindered by the Chief Minister’s arrival and accused her of taking away evidence

title: Trade unions call for general strike on Feb 12, threatens indefinite strike if Labour Codes are not repealed
content: Central Trade Unions stated that if the Government still tries to pursue the Rules under the Codes and does not repeal the Codes, the CTUs will be compelled to go for further strong actions, including a multiple-day General Strike

title: Kerala SIR: technical issues related to Form 6A will be resolved, says Rathan U. Kelkar
content: Organisations had reportedly sought clarity on the hurdle faced by citizens born outside India in filling up the form

title: Not allowed Friday prayers for third week: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: The Mirwaiz’s latest round of alleged house detention came after he dropped the Hurriyat chairman title from his bio on X and accused the authorities of pressuring him for the same

title: Telugu States need to avoid disputes over sharing of water, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Opposition in A.P. seeks disputes with Telangana over Godavari water, but my focus is on utilising the surplus water going waste into the sea through interlinking of rivers to end drought in the State, asserts  Chief Minister

title: Boy being treated for rare non-cancerous tumors at Thiruvananthapuram hospital
content: He is being treated using a patented drug under the KARE (Kerala Against Rare Diseases) scheme. Plexiform Neurofibroma (PN), a rare condition, is seen mostly in childhood and these soft tumours can appear anywhere in the body

title: Ongoing roadworks cripple traffic on Chandapura–Attibele stretch, commuters face daily delays
content: Residents have also flagged the alarming impact on emergency services. Several ambulances, they claim, are getting stuck day and night due to narrowed carriageways, incomplete diversions and haphazard barricading.

title: Assam Opposition parties lodge police complaint against BJP for ‘poll roll manipulation’
content: They allege that State BJP president Dilip Saikia directed Health Minister to take steps to delete voters’ names during an online meeting on January 4

title: India closely following developments in Iran, says MEA
content: On January 5, New Delhi had urged Indian nationals to avoid non-essential travel to Iran and also advised Indian citizens in Iran to exercise due caution and avoid travelling to areas witnessing protests or demonstrations

title: Telangana Rising delegation to aggressively promote the 2047 vision at WEF in Davos
content: The Telangana Rising delegation would present the State’s transformative roadmap to global investors, highlighting its three-pronged economic growth strategy and building on Telangana’s strengths as one of the most developed States in the country.

title: ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’, ‘Tanvi The Great’ among four Indian films eligible for Oscars 2026
content: The other two Indian productions in the list includes the multilingual animated film Mahavatar Narsimha and the Tamil title Tourist Family

title: New district police chief vows strong action against drug menace, crime in Thiruvananthapuram
content: District Police Chief K. Karthick emphasises the need for strong public support to effectively curb the growing menace

title: Will exert Constitutional right to oppose Malayalam Bhasha Bill, CM tells Pinarayi in letter
content: Kannada and Culture Minister Shivaraj Tangadgi said that if needed CM and DyCM will meet President to request her to see that the Bill does not get approval

title: All candidates to undergo face authentication at exam venue, says UPSC
content: Earlier in September 2025, UPSC conducted a pilot programme to test AI-enabled facial authentication technology for swift and secure candidate verification during two examinations; the Commission says the initiative seeks to strengthen the integrity of the examination process

title: Thirupparankundram Deepam issue: Madurai Collector, Deputy Commissioner of Police inform court that they acted on their own
content: Unless proper cause is shown, charges will be framed against the contemnors on February 2, says Justice G. R. Swaminathan of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court

title: HC strikes down Kerala Devaswom Recruitment Board Act provisions that empowered KDRB to appoint candidates
content: The direction came on an appeal filed by the Guruvayur Devaswom Employees Union Congress and others, challenging the relevant provisions of the KDRB Act

title: For the first time, Taliban-appointed diplomat arrives to take charge of Afghan embassy in India
content: Senior Taliban member Mufti Noor Ahmed Noor to take over as Charge d’Affaires; officials say old Afghan flag, staff to remain for now; Mr. Noor visited India in October 2025, Bangladesh in December

title: Karnataka High Court quashes wife’s cruelty complaint against husband for not allowing her to eat French fries after delivery
content: Court has termed woman’s complaint as misuse of Section 498A of IPC and wondered how the police registered FIR on such allegations without preliminary inquiry

title: Censor Board too being weaponised by BJP government, charges T.N. CM Stalin
content: CM Stalin made the comments in a social media post a few hours after the Board cleared Sivakarthikeyan‘s “Parasakthi” movie ahead of its scheduled release on January 10, albeit with 25 cuts

title: Sarvodaya Sanghs in Tamil Nadu seek early release of subsidy arrears by State government
content: With the subsidy amount not coming, the Sarvodaya Sanghs are unable to pay proper wages to the artisans and weavers who are making various products, say the Sangh office bearers

title: SIT indicts Tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru for criminal complicity and conspiracy in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: In the remand report filed late Friday SIT indictes Rajeevaru for misappropriation of temple property, illicit enrichment, and abuse of power for gain under various provisions of the Prevention of Corruption (PC) Act, 1988.

title: Lighter schools bags likely from next year
content: Draft report on creating classrooms without backbenchers also approved by State Curriculum Steering Committee

title: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi concludes official visits to UAE and Sri Lanka
content: Ministry of Defence (MoD) said that during his visit to the UAE from January 05 to 06, General Dwivedi held wide-ranging discussions with senior leadership of the UAE Armed Forces, including the Commander of the UAE Land Forces

title: BJP State leaders stage protest against police ‘disrobing’ woman
content: They meet victim-party worker’s family in Hubballi; Congress releases video of an earlier ‘torture’ case involving the BJP worker

title: CS reviews Bengaluru airport’s new pick-up, parking regulations
content: BIAL has agreed to introduce valet parking services for private vehicles parked in the P4 parking area, enabling vehicles to be brought to the arrival lane within four minutes, and converting it into multi-level parking in future

title: ₹200-crore cluster development programme aims to boost MSMEs in Andhra Pradesh
content: The programme cleared by the Cabinet is expected to directly benefit 1,840 MSME units and generate over 7,500 direct employment opportunities

title: Actor Bhumi Pednekkar, PETA gift mechanical elephant to Thrissur temple
content: The donation was facilitated by PETA in recognition of the temple’s compassionate decision to never own or hire elephants

title: False cases foisted to cover up Tirumala lapses, alleges Bhumana
content: Former TTD chief alleges suppression of security lapses at Tirumala and demands release of full CCTV footage, claiming recovery of 25 gunny bags of empty liquor bottles

title: Councillor’s social media post exposes infighting within Congress in Kozhikode
content: K.C. Shobhita’s post comes against the backdrop of the investigation report over the defeat of KPCC general secretary P.M. Niyas in Paroppadi division in the recent local body polls

title: LDF candidates elected chairpersons of three standing committees in Thripunithura
content: The LDF secured the development, welfare, and education and sports committees, the UDF won two committees, while the BJP, despite leading the council, retained control of only the finance committee

title: BJP delegation meets Governor Ananda Bose against Mamata’s intervention in the ED raid at I-PAC office
content: They also raised concerns about the alleged removal of documents by the Kolkata Police from the site of the ED raid

title: Hyderabad police launch C-Mitra to enable cybercrime FIRs from home
content: Victims are first required to report the fraud. Police officers from the C-Mitra team contact the complainant and prepare a legally sound complaint. The draft complaint is then sent to the victim, who must sign and submit a physical copy

title: Hyderabad metro ridership stagnates amid demand for Phase Two expansion
content: The stagnation and ‘poor patronage’ has resulted in L&T Metro Rail Hyderabad withdrawing night services introduced last year

title: KLIBF: S. Hareesh on latest work Pattunoolpuzhu, its dissimilarities with his debut Meesha
content: Pattunoolpuzhu is almost auto-fiction, the writer says, with inspiration sought from Bibhutibhushan Bandyopadhyay’s Pather Panchali, a book that he read the most in his childhood

title: Leopard sighting on Srivari Mettu footpath triggers panic among pilgrims
content: Twin incidents involving a leopard on the Tirumala footpath and an elephant herd near the ghat road raise concerns over wildlife movement and pilgrim safety on Tirumala routes

title: Congress alleges irregularities in Home Ministry tableaux procurement for Patel anniversary
content: Opposition party questions the role of PM’s brother, claims tender rules and service norms were bypassed

title: 2,862 birds culled in Alappuzha following avian flu outbreak
content: While 2,850 birds were culled in Ambalapuzha North panchayat, 12 eliminated in Ambalapuzha South panchayat. Culling operations will be held in Karuvatta and Pallippad grama panchayats on Saturday

title: A 1998 Kerala High Court order allowed gold covering work at Sabarimala temple, insisted on proper security
content: A group of devotees moved court against the offer made by Vijay Mallya to cover the Sreekovil roof with gold sheets. Their contention was that the work would go against the concept of the deity, Yogeeswara, and that the TDB would have to spend lakhs for security. HC disposed of their petition, gave permission for the work

title: From 10 feet to 3: Gangapatnam creek in Nellore district loses depth, fishers their livelihood
content: Silt accumulation over two decades has disrupted the creek’s fragile ecosystem, forcing fishing families to migrate or take up menial work, while locals press for restoration to sustain their incomes

title: RGUHS to shift its campus to Bengaluru South District by March in phased manner
content: In the first phase, we will shift the administrative block. The examination section will function from the Bengaluru office for some time in the interest of students, says RGUHS V-C

title: Tiruchi-New Jalpaiguri Amrit Bharat Express gets Railway Board nod
content: The train with 22 coaches will leave Tiruchi Junction on Wednesday and reach New Jalpaiguri on Friday. It will leave New Jalpaiguri on Friday and reach Tiruchi on Sunday

title: BJP-led Central government acting against Tamil Nadu and its people: Stalin
content: He says despite the Union government’s non-cooperation, the Dravidian model has made the State excel on various fronts, so much so that even the Centre’s own data shows that T.N. has secured the top spot in several parameters

title: Kerala will raise issue of fiscal curbs at pre-budget consultation: K.N. Balagopal
content: The State has suffered a cut of ₹17,000 crore in its borrowing space in the current fiscal, says the Kerala Finance Minister

title: NDA has weakened legal guarantee of rural employment: Congress
content: G RAM G Act has shifted the financial burden in States, putting rural employment at risk, says Congress leader Valluru Bhargav

title: Idukki gears up for high-stakes battle as UDF, LDF poised to field veteran leaders
content: As Idukki gears up for the 2026 Assembly elections, LDF’s Mani is set to defend his Udumbanchola seat, backed by local party leaders who believe his experience is essential for victory, despite a typical two-term limit. UDF’s P.J. Joseph is likely to contest from Thodupuzha.

title: With depleting air quality, CAQM orders 16 industrial units to be shut in National Capital Region
content: Air quality dips to ‘very poor’ category resulting in measures being taken by the Commission to control pollution levels

title: Additional Chief Secretary seeks report on  delay in issuing charge memo
content: The order pertains to higher officials’ failure to issue charge memo against two suspended Forest officers.

title: Cocoa farmers in Andhra Pradesh seek clear price policy to prevent exploitation
content: They stress the need for the Central government to raise import duties and establish a cocoa board and research centre to support the sector

title: Conclave calls for policy changes to help dairy sector
content: Kerala is fast heading towards self-sufficiency in the dairy sector, and the Malabar region of Milma is noted for the quality of its milk, says Minister J. Chinchurani

title: CM announces govt. medical colleges in all districts, including Vijayapura
content: We will also establish trauma centres and super-speciality hospitals in all districts, says Siddaramaiah after launching several development works

title: Six NFL wild-card games, six matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Packers at Bears. Bryce Young's first playoff game. Justin Herbert vs. Drake Maye. We have picks, stats to know and more for every wild-card game.

title: Sources: Fins closing GM deal with Pack's Sullivan
content: The Dolphins are finalizing a deal to hire Packers vice president of player personnel Jon-Eric Sullivan as their general manager, sources told ESPN.

title: Young writes Hawks farewell, embraces Wiz move
content: Trae Young addressed his trade to the Wizards on social media, writing that he was willing to take a chance outside Atlanta for the first time in his NBA career.

title: Miami's Lewis encourages Lacy, resilient Rebels
content: Hurricanes great Ray Lewis pulled Ole Miss running back Kewan Lacy aside after Thursday night's CFP semifinal, offering advice that reinforced the values of a Rebels team that never quit.

title: Ravens' Monken: 'Didn't coach Lamar well enough'
content: OC Todd Monken accepted the blame for quarterback Lamar Jackson's regression in his third season in the system, telling the "Ryan Ripken Show" he "didn't coach Lamar well enough" and "didn't have as good of a relationship as I could have [with him]."

title: QB Williams runs reverse, stays at Washington
content: QB Demond Williams Jr., who initially signed a big-money deal with Washington only to announce he was entering the transfer portal days later, has decided to remain with the Huskies.

title: Family values: Avs' D posts Gordie trick, like dad
content: Avalanche defenseman Josh Manson had two goals, two assists and a fight to complete the Gordie Howe hat trick in front of his father Dave Manson, a former player who once had his own Howe hat trick.

title: Gold medalist Kim injured ahead of Winter Games
content: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Chloe Kim said Thursday that she dislocated a shoulder in training and her status for the Winter Games is uncertain.

title: Wolves hold moment of silence for Renee Good
content: The Timberwolves held a moment of silence before their game Thursday night for the 37-year-old woman fatally shot in her car by an ICE officer.

title: 🏀 Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: 'I watched every guy': Curt Cignetti's secret to rosters and building Indiana into a CFP power
content: The Hoosiers' roster is filled with different kinds of players, but all had to meet Cignetti's standards.

title: Inside Oregon's rise as a college football blue blood
content: In a sport that often tethers itself to history and tradition, Oregon has become a unique kind of vanguard.

title: 'Not sure why they felt the need': NBA execs on the Trae deal and trade season's next move
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Men's: A weak nonconference slate could doom Georgia
content: The Bulldogs are a few SEC losses away from the wrong side of the bubble due to a number of low-quality wins.

title: Women's: Why LSU's seed could be determined in the next two games
content: LSU has work to do after its 0-2 start in SEC play, but opportunity arrives with the season's most crucial two-game stretch.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: NFL's best QB room? How Mac Jones and Brock Purdy helped each other to the playoffs
content: San Francisco will face Philadelphia on Sunday (4:30 p.m. ET) in part because of a strong bond between the duo.

title: From future HOF pitchers to a veteran catcher: Best fits for under-the-radar MLB free agents
content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: WNBPA president Nneka Ogwumike and VP Napheesa Collier applaud player solidarity but bemoan a lack of progress in CBA negotiations.

title: CBA negotiations: Deadline looms, but extension is unlikely -- so what's next?
content: What does 'status quo' mean, and which issues are players focusing on hours ahead of the Jan. 9 deadline?

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's Olympic players
content: The Lightning are up to No. 2 -- and are tops in players on Olympic rosters. Here's who each team will send.

title: View items from Jim Irsay's iconic memorabilia collection
content: See photos of items from Jim Irsay's extraordinary memorabilia collection headed for auction in March, including Muhammad Ali's WBC championship belt and more.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: A Supercopa Clasico; Inter vs. Napoli; Istanbul derby, more
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? We have a Clasico clash in the Supercopa, two of the best in Italy meeting up, and a table-topping edition of the Istanbul derby.

title: Transfer window weekly: Real Madrid open to Vinícius exit? Chelsea keen?
content: The winter transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: The inside story of the Bears' 'Good, better, best!' craze
content: After each win, Ben Johnson leads the Bears in a chant they hope to keep alive after Saturday night's game vs. the Packers.

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams: Key free agents, draft outlook, priorities and predictions
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 18 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Predicting conference winners -- and their biggest threats
content: The ACC and Big East feature clear favorites, but competition is tighter in the Big Ten, Big 12 and SEC.

title: A sandwich with split loyalties? Peach Bowl concessions include brisket item honoring Oregon, Indiana
content: Indiana and Oregon fans at the Peach Bowl Friday can try Mercedes-Benz Stadium's new 2-foot dueling brisket sandwich, which pays homage to both schools.

title: The 2026 championship parlays: Who will take home this year's trophies?
content: We go on record picking this year's champions, beginning with the CFP and ending with the World Series

title: Bold predictions for 2026: Inoue top P4P, Paul vs. Ngannou, Taylor retires
content: Our panelists weigh in with their predictions on the fights, major events and surprises that could shape boxing in 2026.

title: NLL Week 7 preview: Thunderbirds, Knighthawks facing double duty
content: With eight games on the schedule -- including two apiece for Halifax and Rochester -- here's what to watch for in each of them.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: Indore, In Spotlight Over 20 Deaths, Allocated Rs 2,450 Crore For 'Clean' Water
content: Indore is facing one of its gravest civic and public health failures in recent memory, as at least 20 people have died and more than 3,200 have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in Bhagirathpura and adjoining areas of the city.

title: 'Hawala' Firm In I-PAC Probe Had Surfaced In Delhi Excise 'Scam' Case Too
content: One of the firms under scrutiny in the ED investigation into the Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) is Kolkata-based R Kanti Lal, whose name had earlier surfaced in the agency's probe into the alleged Delhi excise policy scam.

title: Central Power Body's Joint Director Arrested In Rs 9.5-Lakh Bribery Case
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested two persons, including a public servant -- Joint Director of the Central Power Research Institute (CPRI), Bengaluru, Rajaram Mohanrao Chennu -- while they were transacting a bribe.

title: "Dozens Of Warheads": All About Russia's Oreshnik Missile Fired On Ukraine
content: An intermediate-range ballistic missile -- dubbed "Oreshnik" -- used by Russia in an overnight strike on Ukraine is, according to the Kremlin, a "state-of-the art" weapon that cannot be intercepted.

title: High Court Warns Of Contempt Charges In Tamil Nadu Deepam Row
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court today warned that contempt charges would be framed on February 2 against senior Tamil Nadu officials.

title: Protests Against Iran's Regime Spread To Over 45 Cities Amid Deadly Crackdown
content: Iran is witnessing its most significant wave of unrest in years, with more than 40 people dead and over 2,200 arrested as security forces tried to quell protests demanding economic reforms and the removal of the Ayatollah Khomeini-led regime.

title: "At Peak Of Hubris": Khamenei Draws Historical Parallels In Message To Trump
content: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, delivered a warning to the United States as protests driven by economic hardship continue to spread across the country.

title: In Maharashtra Civic Body, Another Twist Puts Eknath Shinde In Driver's Seat
content: When local body elections are spoken about in Maharashtra, the BMC hogs most of the limelight by virtue of being one of the richest civic bodies in Asia. This time, the relatively unknown Ambernath Municipal Corporation is giving it a tough fight.

title: "Unacceptable": UK MP On Killings Of Hindus In Bangladesh
content: UK MP and Shadow Secretary of State for Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Affairs, Priti Patel, on Friday termed the situation in Bangladesh "concerning and worrying" and called for protecting religious freedom in the South Asian nation.

title: Family Of Murdered Dalit Woman Refuse To Perform Last Rites In UP, Demand Justice
content: Grief simmered in Kapsad village in Sardhana area here on Friday following the murder of a Dalit woman and the alleged kidnapping of her daughter, even as a heavy police force has been deployed to maintain law and order, officials said.

title: iPhone Dream Turns Into Rs 51.82 Lakh Crime Spree In Chhattisgarh
content: A woman's iPhone obsession snowballed into a multi-lakh theft operation in Chhattisgarh, complete with gold biscuits, cash-filled suitcases, expensive liquor, and a Harrier SUV bought in cash.

title: 'Focus On Your Responsibilities': India Slams Mamdani's Note For Umar Khalid
content: India on Friday criticised New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani and disapproved of the note he sent to jailed activist Umar Khalid.

title: 17 Hyderabad Students Build Payload For Upcoming ISRO Launch
content: A group of 17 students, aged between 12 and 15, from Hyderabad, designed and built a flight-ready CubeSat payload that will be launched aboard an ISRO mission on January 12 from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC-SHAR) in Sriharikota.

title: Union Budget To Be Presented On February 1 (Sunday), Economic Survey On January 29
content: The Union Budget for 2025-26 will be tabled in Parliament on February 1 - a Sunday - and the Economic Survey, which is a precursor to the budget document, will be presented by Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on January 29.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A Star Targeted? Why Jana Nayagan Row Might Be A Gift In Disguise For Vijay
content: Ultimately, 'Jana Nayagan' will get a certification and will be released. But the damage - or the momentum - may already be inflicted. And, when it does, all this courtroom drama will only bolster its opening at the box office.

title: 12 Killed, 35 Injured After Bus Falls Into 400-Metre Gorge In Himachal Pradesh
content: At least 12 people were killed and 35 others injured on Friday after a private passenger bus plunged nearly 400 metres into a deep gorge in Himachal Pradesh.

title: "Worst Criminal Of Humanity": Pak Defence Minister Wants US To "Kidnap" Netanyahu
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif said that the United States should 'kidnap' Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu if they believe in humanity, just as Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was taken away.

title: Assam Opposition Says BJP 'Conspired' To Omit Voters, Files Police Complaint
content: The Congress-led Opposition in Assam filed a police complaint on Friday, alleging vote theft through the ongoing Special Revision (SR) of the electoral rolls in the state.

title: Sabarimala Theft: Probe Team Arrests Chief Priest Over Replating Temple Gold
content: The SIT probing the Sabarimala gold case arrested chief priest Kandararu Rajeevaru, citing his close links with prime accused Unnikrishnan Potty and his role in recommending the controversial replating of the Dwarapalaka and Sreekovil gold plates.

title: 'How Could I Leave My Son?' Mother Wraps Blanket On Soldiers Statue In Cold
content: In a poignant display of maternal love, Jaswant Kaur, the mother of Constable Gurnam Singh, draped a blanket around his statue in Jammu, shielding him from the biting cold.
